docs.title: Smith
docs.text: The goal of Smith is to create a command-line interface (CLI) tool designed to facilitate the benchmarking of various algorithms. Providing a flexible environment for evaluating algorithm performance using both custom datasets and synthetic data generated by the built-in "faker" module.

docs.title: Planned Features
docs.text:
• Algorithm Benchmarking:
    • Supports benchmarking different types of algorithms
    • Allows users to define and execute benchmark tests with ease.
    • Provides detailed performance metrics (e.g., execution time, memory usage).
  • Dataset Management:
    • Supports loading and processing custom datasets.
    • Includes a built-in "faker" module for generating synthetic datasets with customizable parameters.
    • Offers a variety of commands for manipulating and preparing datasets for benchmarking.
  • CLI Interface:
    • User-friendly and intuitive command-line interface.
    • Provides a set of commands for configuring benchmarks, executing tests, and analyzing results.

docs.title: Developer & Contrbibutors - Quick Start
docs.text:
To clone the repository:

git clone git@github.com:Evanlab02/Smith.git

NOTE: Smith is only supported on some linux machines.

docs.title: Build
docs.text:
To build the executable, you can run the following command:

make clean build

You can now run smith using the following command:

./dist/smith --help

Finally, you can try the following command to try and get it into path:

make install
smith --help

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
To run the tests for the project, you can use the following command:

make test

docs.title: Help command
docs.text:
If you need any more information, there is a help command which displays the help message for the tool.

smith --help

For the faker module, you can use the following command to view its help message:

smith faker --help
